titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Danbury Ledgers
1826-1932
(Bulk 1900-1918)
DRG 1&2 DRG 1&2
titlestmt.author: WCSU Archives Staff

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from a pinted inventory.

publicationstmt.publisher: Western Connecticut State University Archives and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-06-21 18:37:37 -0400.

repository.corpname: Western Connecticut State University Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection includes various Danbury municipal records including military service lists, voting lists, real estate transactions, public utilities expenditures mainly from the early 20th century.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: This collection was obtained by WCSU history faculty out of discarded City of Danbury records. The original material was damaged in a flood and has been microfilmed. Most of the items are available at the City Clerks Office.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open for research without restrictions. Researchers must use microfilm.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Ruth A. Haas Library
Archives and Special Collections
181 White Street
Danbury, CT 06810
Phone: 203-837-8992
E-mail: stevensb@wcsu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Danbury Ledgers; DRG 1 &2; box number; folder number; Western Connecticut State University Archives

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The City of Danbury maintains records on taxes, expenditures and property. Presumably as some of these ledgers were deemed to fragile to handle they were duplicated for use in the Clerks office. Some of them may have passed their retention schedule.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes: Voter Lists, Grand lists, Personal Tax Enrollment, Grantors Index, Danbury-Orders to be Paid, Receipts and Disbursements, Treasurer, Municipal Service Expenditures, Danbury - Military Records - Enrollments/ Recapitulation, Water Applications, Danbury Street Sprinkling, Danbury Water Commissioner Accounts and Records, Danbury - Utilities, Sewer and Paving Assessments, Sewage Plant, Daily Log, Sewer Connection Permits, and the Census of the School District from 1900.

In 1975 two Western Connecticut State University professors, Truman Warner and Herbert Janick, acquired a significant collection of Danbury records (a mixture of town (borough) and city records). An official transfer of custody for these documents does not exist, but it is known that, at the time, the City of Danbury had earmarked the records for disposal. Through the years, it also appears that some records may have been lost, stolen, or discarded. A detailed documentation does not exist.

These Danbury ledgers were sent to Northeast Document Conservation Center for preservation microfilming in 2007. Some items were discovered after the materials were microfilmed; they are included in this inventory noted as "ledgers" and are available in hard copy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Information is generally in chronological order in each resource.
The files are grouped into 1 series.

did.unittitle: Elections - Voter Lists, 1882-1927; ledger: 5-480; Microfilm Reel: 1-14

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound volumes of voters for districts of the Borough (up to 1889) and City (1889 and later) of Danbury, CT. Elections were under the jurisdiction of the Town of Danbury and not the City until consolidation. Books give names and addresses of all registered voters for each election. Check marks indicate which person actually voted in each election. Party affiliations are not recorded. Voters are listed by district for state elections and by ward for town elections. Covers on ledgers state "# district" or "# ward" or "to be made." Included are bound volumes of women voters for pre-1920 elections and the 1920 (ledger 209-213) election where women were first permitted to vote in general elections. Ledgers for primary enrollment indicate party affiliations as do some from the later 1920s (ledgers: 218, 220, 222-228).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bound volumes of tax lists for the Town of Danbury. Ledgers are divided into residents, non-residents, and minorities. Some years list value of public buildings such as churches, schools, courthouse, and jail. Tax lists for individual schools are also listed for some years.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: DG112.1-112.9; DG112.6 is missing; DG112.9 is not digitized

dao.xlink:title: Danbury - Personal Tax Enrollment

daodesc.p: Danbury - Personal Tax Enrollment

odd.head: General
odd.p: Alphabetical list of men, ages 21-60, owing taxes. Includes notation of exemptions (i.e., military service, police officer). 1 ledger.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Not microfilmed. Alphabetical listing of tax liens in connection with the payment of school taxes. Includes amt of tax, amt of lien, when lien was affixed and paid. 1 ledger.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Not microfilmed. Index re purchase and sale of property. Lists property purchased, location, date, mortgage, lease information, etc. Spine reads "Grantees 121-130, General Index #20." Inside "Index to Land Records Danbury, Conn."

dao.xlink:title: Danbury - Grantors Index

daodesc.p: Danbury - Grantors Index

dao.xlink:title: Board of Estimates and Taxation

daodesc.p: Board of Estimates and Taxation

did.unittitle: [DG165] Board of Relief, City of Danbury

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Not microfilmed. Includes names, amt of relief issued and description of the person(s) situation. 4 ledgers.

did.unittitle: [DG165] Board of Relief, City of Danbury

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Not microfilmed. 1 Leather bound ledger from 1898-1900 tracking relief payments. Includes index of names with a list of expenditures. Many of the expenditures are for coal. Very brittle.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Pensioners and pool of draftees and deferments
